iwork.eheap2
Class SecureEvent

java.lang.Object
  iwork.eheap2.Tuple
      iwork.eheap2.Event
          iwork.eheap2.SecureEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
FieldValueTypes
public class SecureEvent
extends Event

This class represents secure events either retrieved from or to be placed into a Secure Event Heap using the SecureEventHeap class. It contains methods to add fields to an event, and set and get field values. The SecureEvent class is synchronized, so you may access it simultaneously from more than one thread. The Secure Event structure is similar to that of the Event, thus refer to the documentation of the Event class for the details. The only additional field is the PrivateFlag field which indicates whether the Secure Event can be received only by the intended receipient or anyone.

Constructor Detail

SecureEvent

public SecureEvent()
            throws EventHeapException
Creates a new Event Heap secure event with all of the defined fields.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was an error constructing the event.

SecureEvent

public SecureEvent(java.lang.String eventType)
            throws EventHeapException
Creates a new Event Heap secure event with all of the defined fields and EventType defined to be 'eventType'

Parameters:
eventType - The type for this new event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was an error constructing the event.

SecureEvent

public SecureEvent(Tuple tuple)
            throws EventHeapException
Creates an event from a Tuple by copying the underlying field data. Once the Event has been constructed, the Tuple should no longer be accessed to avoid synchronization errors since they share the same underlying data structures.

Parameters:
tuple - The tuple upon which to base the event.

SecureEvent

public SecureEvent(java.io.InputStream is)
            throws EventHeapException
Reads the data for an event out of the given input stream and creates a new secure event identical to the one represented in the stream. This just calls the Tuple(InputStream) super class constructor. It does not check to insure that mandatory fields are present.

Method Detail

createSecureEventArray

public static SecureEvent[] createSecureEventArray(Tuple[] tupleArray)
                                            throws EventHeapException
Creates an array of Secure Events from an array of tuples. The tuples are not checked to insure that the fields encode a valid event.

Throws:
EventHeapException

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Returns an object which is a Secure Event identical to this one. All values are copied, so changing referenced objects in the original tuple will not effect the new one. In other words, this is a "deep copy" operation.

Overrides:
clone in class Event
